DOC.detailed_description: Aggressive incident highly prevalent among chronic psychiatric inpatient . Previous study demonstrate potential multivitamin- , mineral- , n-3 fatty acid ( n-3FA ) supplementation reduce aggression adolescent forensic population . To test hypothesis multivitamin- , mineral- , n-3FA supplementation reduces aggression among chronic psychiatric inpatient , design pragmatic , randomised , double-blind , placebo control , multicentre intervention study among psychiatric inpatient reside long-stay psychiatric ward . During 6 month , one group receive 2 supplement daily Orthica : one containing vitamin mineral ( vitamin [ B1 , B2 , B3 , B5 , B6 , B11 , B12 , C , D , E , Beta Carotene ; Calcium , Iodine , Copper , Magnesium , Selenium , Iron , Zinc , Potassium , Chrome , Manganese ] ) one contain fish fatty acid ( n-3FA : eicosapentaenic acid [ EPA ] docosahexaenic acid [ DHA ] ) group receive 2 placebo capsule . The main study parameter number aggressive incident baseline ( t0 ) endpoint ( six month post baseline , t3 ) . Patients wish participate enter 2-week run-in phase take 2 placebo capsule daily . After positive evaluation run-in phase patient randomize active control condition . Participants start daily use 2 supplement capsule 2 placebo capsule , continue 6 month . At 3 time point ( baseline [ t0 ] 2 6 month post-baseline [ t2 t3 ] ) , three questionnaire measure feeling aggression , quality life , psychiatric symptom administer . Also , t0 t3 ( micro ) nutrient status determine . Finally , 4 time point ( t0 , 2 week post baseline [ t1 ] , t2 t3 ) , nursing staff report observe level aggression social dysfunction .
